content.question: The function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, x squared, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What are the first four nonzero terms of the Taylor series for <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, about <math alttext="x equals 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 minus the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x to the eighth power, and denominator 4 factorial, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator x to the twelfth power, and denominator 6 factorial, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 x minus the fraction with numerator 6 times x to the fifth power, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 10 times x to the ninth power, and denominator 5 factorial, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator 14 times x to the thirteenth power, and denominator 7 factorial, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 times x squared, minus the fraction with numerator 5 times x to the fourth power, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 7 times x to the sixth power, and denominator 5 factorial, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator 9 times x to the eighth power, and denominator 7 factorial, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="2 times x cubed, minus the fraction with numerator 2 times x to the seventh power, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 2 times x to the eleventh power, and denominator 5 factorial, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator 2 times x to the fifteenth power, and denominator 7 factorial, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 x minus the fraction with numerator 6 times x to the fifth power, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 10 times x to the ninth power, and denominator 5 factorial, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator 14 times x to the thirteenth power, and denominator 7 factorial, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
